chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
instr: Set
data: Type
one_step: instr -> state -> state -> Prop
sss_fun: forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_dec: forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2}
P: code
st2: state
st1: state
st: state

Goal:
P // st ~~> st1 -> P // st ~~> st2 -> st1 = st2

Premises:
Notation state := (nat * data)%type
Notation code := (nat * list instr)%type

VectorSpec.cons_inj : VectorDef.cons ?A ?a1 ?n ?v1 = VectorDef.cons ?A ?a2 ?n ?v2 -> ?a1 = ?a2 /\ ?v1 = ?v2 where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 ->...-> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- VectorDef.t ?A ?n]

VectorSpec.append_comm_cons : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A ?n) (w : VectorDef.t ?A ?m) (a : ?A), VectorDef.cons ?A a (?n + ?m) (VectorDef.append v w) = VectorDef.append (VectorDef.cons ?A a ?n v) w where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 ->...-> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- nat]

out_code : nat -> subcode.code ?X -> Prop where ?X : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- Type]

EnvRing.PEadd : EnvRing.PExpr ?C -> EnvRing.PExpr ?C -> EnvRing.PExpr ?C where ?C : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- Type]
VarMap.Branch : VarMap.t ?A -> ?A -> VarMap.t ?A -> VarMap.t ?A where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- Type]
subcode : subcode.code ?X -> nat * list ?X -> Prop where ?X : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- Type]
VectorDef.splitat : forall l r : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (l + r) -> VectorDef.t ?A l * VectorDef.t ?A r where ?A : [instr : Set data : Type one_step : instr -> state -> state -> Prop sss_fun : forall (i : instr) (s t1 t2 : state), s ⟬ i ⦒ t1 -> s ⟬ i ⦒ t2 -> t1 = t2 sss_dec : forall (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), {st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} + {~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2} P : code st : state st1 : state st2 : state |- Type]
subcode_sss_terminates_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 ↓ -> P // st1 ↓
subcode_sss_step_inv_1 : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 : state), (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st1 :1> st2 -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2
subcode_sss_compute_instr : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st3 -> P // st1 -> > st3
in_sss_step : forall (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : state), fst st1 = k + length l -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (k, l ++ i :: r) // st1 :1> st2
subcode_sss_steps_stop : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 : state), (forall st : state, ~ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st) -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P//st1-[k] -> st2 -> k = 0 /\ st1 = st2
subcode_sss_steps_inv_1 : forall (P : code) (i : instr) (k : nat) (st1 st2 st3 : state), st1 <> st3 -> st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 -> (fst st1, i :: nil) <sc P -> P//st1-[k] -> st3 -> exists k' : nat, k = S k' /\ P//st2-[k'] -> st3
sss_step = fun (P : code) (st1 st2 : state) => exists (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (d : data), P = (k, l ++ i :: r) /\ st1 = (k + length l, d) /\ st1 ⟬ i ⦒ st2 : code -> state -> state -> Prop
subcode_sss_terminates_inv : forall (P : subcode.code instr) (Q : code) (st st1 : state), Q // st ↓ -> P <sc Q -> P // st ~~> st1 -> Q // st1 ↓
sss_step_fun : forall (P : code) (s t1 t2 : state), P // s :1> t1 -> P // s :1> t2 -> t1 = t2
sss_step_subcode_inv : forall (P : code) (ii : instr) (st st' : state), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> P // st :1> st' -> st ⟬ ii ⦒ st'
sss_stall = fun (ii : instr) (st : state) => forall st' : state, ~ st ⟬ ii ⦒ st' : instr -> state -> Prop
subcode_sss_compute_linstr : forall (k : nat) (li : list instr) (P : code) (st1 st2 st : state), (fst st1, li)//st1-[k] -> st2 -> (fst st1, li) <sc P -> P // st2 -> > st -> P // st1 -> > st

intros.
intros H1 H2.
apply (sss_fun _ _ _ _ H1 H2).
